Posts.Content: May 18, 2009 03:49PM Beth-B wrote: Thanks for your reply, Anne.  My mother had breast cancer, DCIS, diagnosed 2 years ago at age 65. Do you think the surgeon will do a thorough breast exam or any further testing?  Or is it typically just a consultation.  TIA
Posts.Title: Seeing breast surgeon- Beth-B lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: Beth-B wrote: Hi all~ A few weeks ago  I had my baseline mammogram, was called back in for more views, which showed a small cluster of micorcalcifications in my right breast.  Had  stereotactic biopsy, which removed the whole cluster.  Results were benign, but showed hyperplasia in duct with no atypical cells and also showed sclerosing adenosis.  So my  OB still wants me to see a breast surgeon.  Anyone know why- is it to discuss results in detail?  Will he perform any more tests?  Please share your experiences/advice/thoughts...anything. Thanks, Beth Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Seeing breast surgeon- Beth-B lvtwoqlt

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2008 05:14AM Beth wrote: you probably hve a fungal infection, seek a dermatolgist for an accurate diagnosis.  I have them frequently during the summer.  Hope this provides you some relief.
